history.text: I agreed with most critics that Sandra Bullock had a praise-worthy performance in The Blind Side, how about you?
Agreed! What do you like the most about the movie?
I really enjoyed that the storyline revolved around Michael Oher. Do you know what team he played for when he made it to the NFL? I forgot.

nope i don't remember either.  remember the scene where he says i have never one of these? and she asks room
? and he goes? bed!
intense it was
had*
oh Ravens!
Do you like Biographical Sports Dramas generally?
Yes, that's correct, it was the Ravens that he played for. :)
i like biographical movies in general. They don't have to be from about sports.

How much wo
uld you rate the movie on scale on 1 to 10 ?
I'd probably rate it higher than the Rotten Tomatoes score. I think Quinton Aaron really connected with me in portraying the struggle that Michael Oher had to go through.
Do you agree with the ratings that critics seemed to give it?

nope i would give 5 stars! i could definitely see 
 myself doing what leigh Anne did, if i had that crazy money!
Do you mean by adopting Michael into their family?
yes! adopting him and helping him work on his academics to improve his grade.
He performed rather poorly in classes
Oh absolutely, I think that was such a great thing of them to do. It's easy to see that he was troubled from being shuffled around in foster care so much!
Do you think this helped foster his protective instincts?

yeah! what do you think of the part where leigh gets really offended when his friends pass some relly offensive comment about 
big Mike?

I don't remember any parts like that from the movie... There was a part that stood out to me when Leigh Ann has to hire Miss Sue to get Michael into the proper GPA category so he can go to college though!
yes and he does fairly good. The friends part was when they were suggesting that collins might not be safe around big mike and she gets upset
Ah ok, I misunderstood. I think those were Leigh Ann's friends. Definitely goes to show her character and how it connected with Michael's protective instincts, don't you think?

yes! that's probably also why despite mike running away from so many foster home
s decided to settle down with her because of her character
Did you feel like he was going to make bad decisions when he went back to find his biological mom in Hurt Village?

yeah! for a moment. especially because he was misjudging the intentions of Leigh. I thought he would stay there and would't go back. but It was commendable of him to fight back the gang leader and trusting Leigh.
For sure, the gang leader should've thought twice! Did you think he made the right choice for where to go to School?
or was it later? i'm confused! do you remember What was he so upset about ?
Michael? Michael was upset because the gangleader was saying some pretty terrible things about LeighAnn and Collins
The gang leader was probably upset because he got whooped :)
haha i guess so
All in all, great movie! Good talking to you about it
same here :) bye :)

uid1response.feedback: The conversation was pretty smooth, but it definitely didn't feel natural since we had to stick to facts only listed on the sheet.
